column4: As diesel price soars  U.S. refiners seize the moment  sell future output
column5: NEW YORK U.S. diesel futures have soared about 40 percent in the last two months  prompting independent refiners to pounce  selling future output on the view that resurgent domestic demand and higher exports may turn out to provide only a brief boost.

column5: WASHINGTON  June 3 The U.S. economy created the fewest number of jobs in more than 5-1/2-years in May as manufacturing and construction employment fell sharply  which could make it harder for the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates.
